etymology.description: 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") + phonetic: 冗(冗) (rǒng) = something sinking in water -> sink
etymology.interpretation: The character uses 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") to indicate the context of water, implying the act of sinking, with 冗(冗) (rǒng) providing the phonetic component.

examples.chinese: 小船在湖中沉(小船在湖中沈)。
examples.english: The little boat sinks in the lake.

examples.chinese: 当铁块被水浇时(當鐵塊被水澆時)，它迅速沉入河底(它迅速沈入河底)。
examples.pinyin: Dāng tiěkuài bèi shuǐ jiāo shí, tā xùnsù chén rù hé dǐ.
examples.english: When the iron block is doused with water, it sinks rapidly to the riverbed.
